comments:
I imported a project from CVS.

While it was building in the background (contained error due to missing
interface) I imported the project containing the missing interface.

In the error dialog I clicked on "Show CVS Console".

Version: 3.1.0
Build id: 200411050810

Created an attachment (id=15887)
pic showing the deadlocked UI

The modal "User Operation Is Waiting" dialog is active.

Clicking on the cancel square had no effect.

Did you attach the proper screenshot? When I open it, it is the one from the 
Tag as Version dialog. Also, there is not much we can do without a stacktrace. 
Is this reproducable for you? If so, can you start Eclipse using java.exe 
(instead of javaw.exe) and the -debug -consolelog flags. Then, when the 
deadlock occurs, do a CTRL-BREAK in the DOS window to get the trace.

I also notice from the errors in the error log that you are out of disk space. 
This could be the cause of the problem.

Oops, yes it is the wrong screenshot. Unfortunately I overwrote the other one :/

The screenshot showed the dialog named "Multiple Errors have occured". I then
clicked on "Show CVS Console".

The modal "User Operation Is Waiting" dialog was immediately shown.

It had no Details and Cancel buttons at the bottom and no information area at
the top; it just contained the "list" in the middle.

I think this might be a problem of the concurrency layer.

So far I could not reproduce it.

I could reproduce the displayal of the "Multiple Errors have occured" dialog but
apparently there was another job running in the background which blocked the
displayal of the Console view.

Although not really INVALID, I'm closing this bug because there is nothing we 
can really do without a reproducable case or a stacktrace. Please reopen if 
this occurs again and you can provide the stack trace.
